dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, Joe Biden topped Google Trends this year, which is pretty huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, Joe Biden topped Google Trends this year, which is pretty huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President-elect Joe Biden is on his way to being sworn in as president next month, but in the meantime hes won another honor: topping this years Google Trends, according to the tech giants Year in Search review.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the peak was actually the week before the election, right? Late October.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, um, that was when the Associated Press called his win. And then Kim Jong-un was second most searched.

After Biden, the most searched people were North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un particularly in April, when rumors he had died circulatedfollowed by Vice President-elect Kamala Harris.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting though—Trump didn't even make the top ten this year, did he?

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Donald Trump didnt land in the top 10, though he was the most Googled person in the world in 2016, the year he was elected president.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Nope, not on Google Trends, but he was the most tweeted about person of the year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope, not on Google Trends, but he was the most tweeted about person of the year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, Trump did take the top spot this week for the most tweeted about person of the year, followed by Biden, while Harris was the most tweeted about woman on the platform.

dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, so still dominating on Twitter then. And what about the top search terms overall?

HostA: So, uh, Joe Biden topped Google Trends this year, which is pretty huge.
HostB: Yeah, and the peak was actually the week before the election, right? Late October.
HostA: Exactly, um, that was when the Associated Press called his win. And then Kim Jong-un was second most searched.
HostB: Oh right, because of those rumors he had died back in May. That was wild.
HostA: And Kamala Harris came in third. She’s been getting a ton of attention too.
HostB: It’s interesting though—Trump didn’t even make the top ten this year, did he?
HostA: Nope, not on Google Trends, but he was the most tweeted about person of the year.
HostB: Oh wow, so still dominating on Twitter then. And what about the top search terms overall?
HostA: Election results beat out coronavirus for number one, which says a lot about 2020.
HostB: For sure. And then things like "how to donate to Black Lives Matter" and "Covid testing near me" were up there too.
HostA: Yeah, and don’t forget "WAP" and "Elon Musk baby"—those were everywhere.
HostB: It’s like a snapshot of the whole year, honestly. The serious and the random all mixed together.
HostA: Totally. And SpaceX got nearly 900 million in FCC subsidies for rural broadband, which is another big tech story.
